description:
Index of wholesale prices

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
61281 Index of selling prices in wholesale trade

Definition:
The index of wholesale prices measures the movement of the
prices of goods sold by wholesalers in Germany to the extent
that these sales are included under wholesale, such as
contracts concluded with resellers, processors or other
large customers. This may refer to goods produced in the
domestic territory or to imported goods. Not covered are
cases where producers sell goods directly to retailers or
final consumers. The reference variable of the overall index
is the total of all turnovers realised in wholesale trade in
the base year, less retail sales, export values and other
sales not belonging to wholesale trade. In this way,
turnover realised between wholesale businesses is also
covered by price statistics (no-netting principle of price
index calculation for any economic sector). As regards the
major steps of calculation, the index can be referred to as
the weighted mean of the price relatives (average
relatives), which are determined for a representative
selection of goods for resale (price representatives). The
turnover shares of the selected products in the base year
are used as weights.

The individual price series are shown as index numbers based
on the prices in the base year (= 100). They are based on
the results of the monthly collection of prices performed
with a representative sample of wholesale businesses. The
reference date of the surveys is the fifth day of the
reference month. The prices contractually agreed upon on
that day (possibly shortly before or after) are collected.

The monthly values of an individual price series should
reflect only pure price changes. To achieve this, all
factors relevant for the price level - the price-determining
variables - have to be kept constant for as long as
possible. This applies not only to the overall quality of
the goods monitored, their unit of quantity and quantity
sold, but also to the various terms of trade, delivery and
payment. If one of these variables changes, suitable quality
adjustment methods will be applied.

The prices collected monthly are actual prices (no list or
basic prices or average receipts), excluding turnover tax,
but including any excise duties (e.g. mineral oil tax,
tobacco tax) and other legal duties (e.g. oil storage
contribution for mineral oil products). Currently, selling
prices are collected from roughly 1,200 reporting units in
66 economic branches. The index is based on a total of about
3,600 individual price series. For the product categories of
fruit and vegetables, potatoes and animal feed, meat and
livestock, and sea fish, price quotations at important
central markets and commodity exchanges are used, too.

The index is calculated through the Laspeyres formula. This
means that the weights from the current base year will
remain unchanged until the index will be put on a new base
year.

The index of wholesale prices is calculated and released not
only as an overall series but also in a breakdown according
to the Classification of Economic Activities (Klassifikation
der Wirtschaftszweige - WZ).
